intro: Drosanthemum delicatulum, commonly known as the delicate drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
